trans-unit.source: Manually set the value of the @extended macro.

seg-source.mrk: Manually set the value of the @extended macro.

target.mrk: Manually set the value of the @extended macro.

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: The required value (integer) to set into the @extended macro.

seg-source.mrk: The required value (integer) to set into the @extended macro.

target.mrk: The required value (integer) to set into the @extended macro.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The value to be returned by the function - if no parameter used the return value is undefined.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
The value to be returned by the function - if no parameter used the return value is undefined.

target.mrk: [optional]
The value to be returned by the function - if no parameter used the return value is undefined.

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: Returns the "return value" parameter (undefined if the parameter is not used).

seg-source.mrk: Returns the "return value" parameter (undefined if the parameter is not used).

target.mrk: Returns the "return value" parameter (undefined if the parameter is not used).

trans-unit.source: @extended will be set to the values set in the function call (default = 0)

seg-source.mrk: @extended will be set to the values set in the function call (default = 0)

target.mrk: @extended will be set to the values set in the function call (default = 0)

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: When entering a function @extended is set to 0. Unless SetExtended() is called, then @extended will remain 0 when the function ends. This means that in order for @extended to be set after a function returns, it must be explicitly set in the function. This also means you may need to backup the status of @extended in a variable if you are testing it in a While-WEnd loop.

seg-source.mrk: When entering a function @extended is set to 0.
Unless SetExtended() is called, then @extended will remain 0 when the function ends.
This means that in order for @extended to be set after a function returns, it must be explicitly set in the function.
This also means you may need to backup the status of @extended in a variable if you are testing it in a While-WEnd loop.

target.mrk: When entering a function @extended is set to 0.
Unless SetExtended() is called, then @extended will remain 0 when the function ends.
This means that in order for @extended to be set after a function returns, it must be explicitly set in the function.
This also means you may need to backup the status of @extended in a variable if you are testing it in a While-WEnd loop.

trans-unit.source: The return value parameter is optional. It is provided as a way to use the Return SetExtended(...) syntax to define the value to be returned at the same time as setting @extended. If a specific value is not set then the return value will be undefined and should not be used subsequently by the code.

seg-source.mrk: The return value parameter is optional.
It is provided as a way to use the Return SetExtended(...) syntax to define the value to be returned at the same time as setting @extended.
If a specific value is not set then the return value will be undefined and should not be used subsequently by the code.

target.mrk: The return value parameter is optional.
It is provided as a way to use the Return SetExtended(...) syntax to define the value to be returned at the same time as setting @extended.
If a specific value is not set then the return value will be undefined and should not be used subsequently by the code.

trans-unit.source: @extended is limited between the values of -2147483648 to 2147483647.

seg-source.mrk: @extended is limited between the values of -2147483648 to 2147483647.

target.mrk: @extended is limited between the values of -2147483648 to 2147483647.
